title: ICD-10 Follies: Assault by Drowning While in Bathtub
author: David Pittman
description: Yes, there's a code for that. To mark the forthcoming move to the ICD-10 coding system, MedPage Today is spotlighting some of those thousands of new codes that might just be getting a bit too
cleaned_text: It is [235 days](http://daycalc.appspot.com/10/01/2014) before the move to ICD-10 becomes a must-do. [Lest the deadline slip your mind](https://www.medpagetoday.com/PracticeManagement/InformationTechnology/44157), MedPage Today is spotlighting some of those [thousands of new codes](https://www.medpagetoday.com/PracticeManagement/InformationTechnology/36849) that might just be getting a bit too granular. Today's code: X92.0: [Assault by drowning and submersion while in bathtub](http://www.pitchstonehealth.com/coding/icd10/X92.0--assault-by-drowning-and-submersion-while-in-bathtub) (Note that this code allows for subsequent visits, even though, [as the blogger Skeptical Scalpel points out](http://skepticalscalpel.blogspot.com/2011/09/icd-10-codes-drowning-and-submersion.html) in discussing another code involving drowning, "Once one drowns, he is dead." Little opportunity for even
